value.title: Train at your own pace for a career in Big Data with courses on Python, Excel, Power BI and much more
value.excerpt: You can develop the skills required for lucrative data analyst careers while working full-time and without going into debt, even if you have no previous tech experience whatsoever.

value.title: How machine learning speeds up Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Machine learning delivers insights in Power BI reports—and it enables you to get a large amount of data into your reports to generate those insights more quickly.

value.title: Learn the skills to be a data analyst with courses on Python, Excel, Power BI and more

value.title: Microsoft Power BI and Azure Purview better together – now Generally Available

value.title: Join Us! Power BI Dev Camp: Thursday 28 Oct 2021 at 11:00 AM PDT
value.excerpt: This deep dive session teaches campers how to use deployment pipelines for managing the application lifecycle of datasets and reports and for enabling CI/CD in a Power BI environment. The session explains how deployment pipelines are configured to create dedicated workspaces for developing and testing

value.title: Power BI Desktop Installer Changes & WebView2
value.excerpt: As mentioned in the June and July feature summaries, we are switching a vital component of Power BI from CefSharp to WebView2. value.title: Topic: power bi premium
value.excerpt: Microsoft is expanding its business analytics and intelligence portfolio with the announcement of Power BI Premium. Power BI Premium is an extension of the company’s Power BI solution that ...

value.title: Power BI October 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Welcome to the October 2021 update. Leaves fall, Power BI calls; and we are excited to release additional functionality and performance improvements for DirectQuery, optimization for the SWITCH function,  and new Bitwise DAX functions.

value.title: Power BI Streaming Dataflows October Update
value.excerpt: We are thrilled to announce some exciting new capabilities for streaming dataflows in Power BI.

value.title: Power BI Update - October 2021
value.excerpt: Welcome to the October 2021 update. Leaves fall, Power BI calls; and we are excited to release additional functionality for DirectQuery, improvements for the SWITCH function, and new Biwise DAX functions. There is more to explore, please continue to read on.  Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/mspowerbi

value.title: New authentication option facilitates AAS migrations to Power BI Premium at a low price point
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce that XMLA endpoints on Premium Per User (PPU) now support Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication with service principals. This authentication option enables administrative applications to perform automated maintenance tasks and unattended service-level operations by using

value.title: Power BI Unused Artifacts API (preview)
value.excerpt: We are pleased to announce the preview availability of our new Unused Artifacts API. The initial version of this API returns a list of datasets that have not been used within 30 days for a specified workspace, and successive revisions will include other artifact types such as reports and dashboards.

value.title: General Availability of next-gen Premium Platform
value.excerpt: We happily announce Next Gen Premium Platform (Gen2) Generally Available! Optional autoscale charges will begin  November 4th 2021

value.title: Security Group Support for Log Analytics Integration (Preview)
value.excerpt: AD Security Group support is now available for Log Analytics for Premium workspaces. This allows Tenant administrators to control which Workspace admins can use the Log Analytics integration to log activities from their Power BI workspace.

value.title: Power BI Report Server September 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We’re excited to bring you a new version of Power BI Report Server this Fall! With the September 2021 update, we have a variety of new enhancements, including line charts improvements, new formatting options for buttons, small multiples new feature, and new Model View.

value.title: Join Us! Power BI Dev Camp: Thursday 30 Sept 2021 at 11:00 AM PDT
value.excerpt: Scott Sewel of the Microsoft Power BI CAT team will demonstrate the value that Power BI brings to the Power Platform with this month’s topic: Developing Power BI for Dataverse + Power Apps and Dynamics 365 CE. A great opportunity to see how all of these amazing products work together.

value.title: Summary of Power BI desktop update September 2021
